result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher David Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher David Perkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher David Perkins in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS SENTENCE IS CONCURRENT TO THE SENTENCE IN CASE 14CF5140, BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Corrections (STRAIGHT TIME), concurrent to case 14CF5140 consecutive to any other sentence.
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

Conditions of Probation to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Court ordered restitution be set at zero.

- Court ordered no DNA sample/DNA surcharge on this case as one has been ordered in case 14CF5140.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, by the end of probation, if revoked out of up to 25% prison funds.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court approved participation in the Dosage Probation Pilot Program and probation may be terminated early if the defendant successfully completes the program and all other conditions of probation.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or Misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  

- Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Christopher David Perkins in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED and read in.  As to COUNT 2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher David Perkins in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher David Perkins in court with Michael Jude for attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Christopher David Perkins in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Christopher David Perkins in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Christopher David Perkins in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
